result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Case dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing in case #14CF917.
Case dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing in case #14CF917.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breon Monte Keys-Somerville

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in court with attorney Dan Mitchell for Angele R. Dentice.  Katherine Seelow for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#14CF917.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  David Behm for Angele Dentice appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 22 accepts case as part of a global resolution with case#14CF917.
Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Dentice informed the Court that she is not available on the scheduling conference date that was selected. A new scheduling conference date of 08/27/2015 at 8:30 in Branch 37 was selected.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  NO BAIL PREVIOUSLY FORFEITED.  Bail on deposit to remain the same.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered NO bail posted to be forfeited at this time.

15RM028617  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-09-15

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Breon Monte Keys-Somerville in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
